description.narrative: By 2023, policy and institutional frameworks that protect children from of violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage are strengthened, which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys in Madagascar, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected from violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage

sector.narrative: Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
Child protection focused on care and support for children with disabilities
Ending violence against women and girls
Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Public finance management for child protection
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring

title.narrative: UNICEF Madagascar Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Madagascar Impact Evaluation of Fiavota Phase 1 Emergency and Recovery Cash Transfer in Madagascar
Madagascar 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, policy and institutional frameworks that protect children from of violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage are strengthened
